comments:
Eclipse starts fine on first attempt after my computer has been rebooted/started. After closing down Eclipse and attempting to restart it later, it does not appear to load the workspace and will not start. Error log entry follows:

!SESSION 2006-07-18 21:37:49.562 -----------------------------------------------

Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -clean

!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1

Would you have a process that could delete extracted files or something like that?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Would you have a process that could delete extracted files or something like
> that?

Thanks for the reply, Pascal. I'm not following you, though. Could you please explain in more detail?

I notice that you are running with -clean each time.  Can you try launching without the -clean option?  To make sure I understand you correctly:  

Every time you reboot your machine you are able to start eclipse once but eclipse will fail every time after that as long as your computer is not rebooted.  After eclipse fails to launch if you reboot you can then start eclipse once and only once but then it starts to fail again.

Is there anything special about your file system?  What type of file system is it?
Closing. Not reproducible and further details not provided.
